executive_summary: Consumers have long viewed frozen foods as nutrient-deficient or time-saving options that are simple to prepare. Over the past five years, the Frozen Food Wholesaling industry has sought to change the former and capitalize on the latter. As consumers become increasingly busy yet remain cost-conscious, the need for convenient meals has bolstered demand for frozen food. Shifting consumer preferences are spurring product innovation, driving demand for meatless, gluten-free and organic frozen foods. Still, escalating competition is mitigating frozen food sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition Looms Over Frozen Food Wholesalers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Frozen food wholesalers face increasing external competition from general-line grocery wholesalers with larger-scale economies and one-stop shopping options for customers. As large manufacturers have increasingly established their own distribution divisions, merchant wholesalers have struggled to keep up. Heightened competition has squeezed sales for wholesalers who've been forced to innovate their product lines and consolidate operations.

Food service establishments represent more than one-third of frozen food wholesalers' sales. The COVID-19 pandemic crushed restaurants and other food service establishments, leaving wholesalers without demand from this substantial market segment. Industry revenue from food service sales declined in 2020 and 2021 as a result of pandemic-related shutdowns and declining consumer demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Strong Economy is Set to Fuel Spending on Frozen Food
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A rebounding US economy will boost grocery and food service sales over the next five years, supporting demand for wholesaled frozen food. Consumers relying on quick and convenient meal options will drive demand for frozen foods as a return to the office will leave workers strapped for time. Product innovation and improvements to the frozen food shopping experience will help counter shifting consumer preferences toward fresh and organic food.

Growing demand for fresh and organic foods will threaten demand for frozen food, particularly for staple products like meat, seafood, vegetables and fruits. Institutional cafeterias, including schools, hospitals and government and military offices, are increasingly seeking fresh food options. Still, demand for frozen foods will remain steady as consumers continue to eat restaurant meals with frozen ingredients.

industry_definition: This industry primarily wholesales packaged frozen foods, excluding dairy products. Wholesaling in this industry involves the resale of frozen food products to downstream sectors, including restaurants, food service outlets, grocery stores and other retailers and wholesalers. Products include packaged frozen meats, poultry, seafood, fruits and vegetables, juices, bakery products, pizzas and other frozen meals.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Per capita disposable income

key_trends: COVID-19 disrupted downstream demand for frozen food.
Negative perceptions of frozen food compared to fresh have mitigated wholesalers' growth.
Rising health consciousness is spurring product innovation.
Upstream tariffs raise purchase costs for wholesalers.
Frozen food wholesalers are subject to moderate regulations.
Frozen entrees are popular despite negative health perceptions.
Food service establishments endured adverse pandemic conditions.
Wholesalers settle in the West to minimize transportation costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market includes restaurants, fast-food chains, school cafeterias, military institutions and other food service establishments.
This market includes grocery stores and other retailers.
This segment includes wholesalers that sell to major supermarket distributors well as small specialty wholesalers.
Other selling markets include sales to household customers, manufacturers, businesses for end use, and governmental customers.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes single-serve entrees, handheld entrees and multi-serve entrees.
Meat, poultry and fish are popular with consumers and industrial and institutional customers.
Frozen items appeal to consumers because of the short shelf life of fresh meat and seafood.
This segment includes a variety of frozen pizzas.
This segment includes frozen appetizers and snack rolls.
Meat, poultry and fish are popular with consumers and industrial and institutional customers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Frozen Entrees Push Past Negative Perception
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Wholesalers have responded to shifting consumer preferences by offering more organic, meatless and less-processed frozen entrees.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Meats, Poultry and Seafood Last Longer in the Freezer
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Meat products are key components in large-scale meal preparation.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Frozen Pizza Sales Climb Amid Pandemic Conditions
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Frozen pizza is a staple item in many households, particularly during the pandemic.
Frozen appetizers are popular among large households or gatherings.

business_locations.location: Manufacturers Bring Wholesalers to the West
business_locations.location_description: The West has the country's greatest share of frozen food manufacturers.

business_locations.location: Frozen Food Wholesalers Locate in the Populated Southeast
business_locations.location_description: The Southeast holds the highest share of the US population.

business_locations.location: The Mid-Atlantic Is a Transportation Hub
business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic has a significant share of frozen food wholesaling establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FEDERAL FOOD, DRUG AND COSMETIC ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Act ensures that frozen food is safe for consumption.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Nutrition Labeling and Education Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: This Act includes requirements for accurate labeling and nutrition information.
Federal statutes like the Fair Labor Standards Act mandate labor standards.
This Act requires food establishments to register with federal authorities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline stage of its life cycle.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesalers set themselves apart through innovative products.
MSBOs have a competitive advantage over wholesalers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Distributors operate locally to stay connected to customers.
The industry is ripe for mergers and acquisitions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation costs differ depending on the size and type of wholesaler operations.
Purchases represent the overwhelming majority of costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages remain flat as hiring comes to a halt
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wholesalers have increased productivity through automation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Wholesaling requires substantial labor for sales, delivery and inventory management
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Labor is crucial for operating a successful wholesaler business.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: A lower rate of new patents suggests stability but low innovation.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified

FAQs.question: Do your company's sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers of industry products generally see increased demand during economic downturns.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one product segment or wholesale a wide array of products?
FAQs.answer: Diversified wholesalers often experience lower revenue volatility.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to revenue volatility?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers can stabilize by entering long-term supply contracts.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in proximity to key buying and selling markets?
FAQs.answer: Proximity to customers lowers transportation costs and increases profitability.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging the latest technologies?
FAQs.answer: Adopting new technologies can minimize waste and improve efficiency.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to increase operational efficiencies via technological adoption?
FAQs.answer: Technological advancements enhance productivity and can lower wage costs.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure that all occupational health and safety standards are upheld?
FAQs.answer: Compliant wholesalers benefit from lower insurance premiums.

FAQs.question: Is your company prepared to meet shifting environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Adopting green practices can increase marketability.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare to those of your largest competitors?
FAQs.answer: Minimizing labor costs leads to higher profitability.

FAQs.question: Does your company face any difficulty financing ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: Long-term contracts help stabilize cash flows.

FAQs.question: Which niches, if any, do you cater to? How do you keep track of the latest trends?
FAQs.answer: Exposure to various markets helps weather economic shocks.

FAQs.question: Do you deliver data to clients as they require it or is there a lag? Does your company use software-as-a-service applications?
FAQs.answer: Efficient distribution networks are crucial for customer satisfaction.

FAQs.question: Are you located close to your target markets and suppliers? Can you relocate closer to your main distributors and end-users?
FAQs.answer: Close proximity to markets and suppliers improves efficiency.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in the healthy eating index? Does a lower index heighten demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The index affects perceptions and, consequently, demand for frozen foods.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? Do you wholesale price-premium products?
FAQs.answer: Disposable income fluctuations affect purchasing patterns.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in the agricultural price index? How do rising produce prices affect your profit?
FAQs.answer: Price index changes can impact overall industry profitability.
